name: Swan at Streatley

reviews.title: I love this place
reviews.text: Returned to this hotel for the 3rd time in as many years. Stayed for one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary - and had a great time. The setting is idyllic. What could be nicer than sitting out on the terrace alongside the river having afternoon tea, watching the swans and cygnets and if you're lucky, the odd kingfisher flashing by.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with a river view. It was very spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was large and really comfortable with a fluffy feather duvet. Bathroom was also huge -plenty of room for your all your bits, and I liked the Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries. We had dinner in the restaurant which was delicious, although the portions are a bit on the small side.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting - dreadful hotel

reviews.text: I've read many negative reviews for this hotel - so maybe we were lucky, but we love this place. If you're looking for somewhere shiny & modern then this isn't the place for you, but it has great character and a sense of history. Look out for cheap deals on the internet rather than paying full price.
reviews.title: A relic of the past

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The setting was beautiful and the towels were white and fluffy , there ends the good news. The room was tired grubby and drab with a mix match of furnishings. The two easy chairs were so dirty and sticky we spend what little time we had to in the room sitting on the edge of the bed. The bathroom was dirty and dated . We stayed for two nights , only because there was a cancelation charge if we left. The room was serviced!!!! in the morning and on our return the duvet had been pulled up and the pillows had not been touched and still retained the imprint of our heads from the night before. Most definately not even 2 star standard.
reviews.title: Consistently....... Disappointing

reviews.text: My husband booked three bedrooms here for a family stay on 16th/17th July. Even as one approachs the entrance .. OMG springs immediately to mind .. Why did we decide to book this shabby chic hotel. We stayed in one of their best rooms (No.12) which had a balcony overlooking the River Thames. The bed to be fair was very comfortable and the view excellent but we had to put up with VERY creaky floorboards and it took 10 minutes to balance hot/cold water for the shower. The duck main course on the first evening was unacceptable (tough and overcooked).
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.text: I have been to this place on several occasions and on each it is different. I thought it might be a Shrine to Danny la Rue, but it is not. It is for the well behaved child, especially with Grandparents. The place where memories are made.
reviews.title: ALMOST PERFECTION

reviews.text: There is a Mississippi Boat moored and for hire. A real piece of history.
reviews.title: DON'T HOLD UP TO THEIR CHARGES

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Different staff and atmosphere, on each occasion, but the quality is the same.
reviews.title: Such a shame

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and approachable. That being said, I did have one member who was less than polite and a tad accusatory, but that was sorted out by senior management within half an hour. A full apology and a realization that it was language barrier. I was upset by the incident but appreciated the immediate action.
reviews.title: Good for a Small Hotel!

reviews.text: The food is excellent and the location even better.
reviews.title: Traditional standards

reviews.text: I booked a girly treat weekend away for myself & a friend to the swan, and wgat a great hotel, and the location is fabulous - unbelievable.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We found it quite formal - however, clearly that is what people go for, a special experience. It was in no way stuffy, the staff were very helpful, chatty & Ewan who worked the bar was a great staff member.
reviews.title: Has potential to be great

reviews.text: Our room was huge, bit disappointed bathroom bit dated, but riverside view made up for this.
reviews.title: Shame about the changes - especially the new chef

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a dip in the pool, bit too small to swim in, had a sauna, jacuzzi as part of teh experience, and all included.
reviews.title: "Location and Food excellent"

reviews.text: We only had a sandwich at lunch, so can not comment on meals.
reviews.title: Glorious location, and a great spa.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The Swan for one evening for a friend's (local) party.
reviews.title: Could be so much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The approach to the pub is lovely, driving along the Thames from the M4 on a lovely summer's evening then into the quiet village of Streatley.
reviews.title: Don't go there!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right next to the river and so has an enviable outlook, but the hotel building itself is pretty ugly as it clearly has had bits added to it over the years (the 70's and 80's mainly, by the style of building), so that it is elongated and has a fairly dated interior room. Long corridors abound.
reviews.title: Too much trouble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was swift (although my friend who checked in before told me it took ages). The room was comfortable but tired. The bathroom was in major need of an overhaul - the shower (a long lead from the bath taps basically) was either hot or cold and nothing in-between and the toilet base had gaffa tape round it.
reviews.title: Staff need to cheer up a bit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for a drink before going out but it took us about 15 minutes to get served as there was a long queue at the bar. Admittedly it was a (rare) warm summer's evening, but there seemed to be plenty of staff on.
reviews.title: Lovely Friendly Hotel

aka: Swan At Streatley Hotel Streatley On Thames
description: Set in an idyllic location, The Swan at Streatley on the banks of the river Thames in the picturesque Berkshire village of Streatley, has been welcoming guests since the 1700's. With 39 bedrooms and suites, a newly renovated Riverside Restaurant and a relaxed bar and terrace along with a gym and treatment rooms, The Swan is a place to relax, socialise, eat great food and enjoy the river and countryside. Guests and locals can also enjoy the newly opened Boat House Cafe & Deli (see our separate listing) offering British artisan produce and light refreshments. The hotel also offers conference and banqueting facilities and remains one of the most popular scenic locations for weddings in Berkshire and Oxfordshire.
